name: LQZ Cold Press Juicer, Slow Masticating Juicer Machines, 350W Juice Extractor Machine, 5.3" Large Bore Feed Chute Fit Whole Vegetables and Fruits, Easy to Clean Juicer(Black)
about_this_item: „ÄêEasy and Safe to Operate„ÄëOur masticating juicer comes with a large 5.3-inch feed chute with a blade-less design that stops the machine when the lid is opened. It not only improves juicing efficiency, but also ensures safety!

„Äê50rpm Slow Grinding Technology„ÄëOur cold press juicer, through the multi-stage extrusion technology, low-speed slow squeezing technology, can effectively reduce the damage to the cell structure of the fruit in the process of juicing, reduce the heat generation and oxidation, so as to retain more nutrients and the original flavor of the fruit.

„ÄêMultifunctional and Efficient„Äë This 350W masticating juicer comes with a food-grade auger head that handles a wide range of vegetable and fruit, a dual-layer filter that separates the pulp for a smoother texture, and a juice yield of 99 percent.
„ÄêEasy to Clean„ÄëOur all-in-one cold press juicer has only three parts and comes with a special cleaning brush for quick assembly, disassembly and cleaning!

„ÄêTroubleshooting Steps„Äë1.When installing the cold press juicer, make sure that the handle is perfectly aligned with the position of the on button.2.Insert the Spiral Grinding Head into the bottom and rotate counterclockwise to ensure that the Spiral Grinding Head is fully seated on the motor shaft.3.You should make sure that the cover is pressed down tightly.After confirming that the above steps are correct and the cover is tightly closed, try to turn on the device again.

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is my first juicer, so I do not have much to compare to. I started with oranges, removed the peel and as much white stuff in there as possible. The pulp came out fairly dry and there was plenty of juice. I moved on near the end of the oranges with blueberries. I have read these can give a bit of a problem for this kind of juicer. But I did get the juice out of them. Albeit a little thicker than the orange. I finished with a no-no for this juicer...Strawberries. The instructions say not to use strawberries as they are starchy in texture and can clog the machine. Well, I have over 100 pounds of frozen strawberries from my garden this year, and I wanted to try it. Very happy with the results. Now, full disclosure. When you thaw strawberries in the microwave, a lot of juice is already released. I just poured this into the juice collector, and then added the thawed berries to the juicer. Plenty more juice came out. Again, a little thicker, and the pulp that came out the pulp shoot was still fairly wet. But here is the best part. The pulp tasted amazing. Essentially like a good jam. You could totally just freeze the pulp as freezey pops or use right away as jam for toast. I did not try the orange or blueberry pulp this way. It didn't look as appetizing coming out.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
